Group1.info:
Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To exist in large numbers or amounts.
Example: The forests abound with wildlife during spring.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking a defined shape or form; vague.
Example: The artist painted an amorphous figure that left much to interpretation.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance; plain and simple.
Example: The monk led an austere lifestyle, devoid of luxuries.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To give a false impression; to contradict.
Example: Her calm demeanor belied the anxiety she felt inside.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
Example: The capricious weather made it hard to plan the outdoor event.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Intellectual rather than emotional or physical.
Example: The book appealed to readers with a cerebral approach to philosophy.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Pleasant because of personality, qualities, or interests that are similar to one's own.
Example: She found her new colleagues to be congenial and easy to work with.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Easily seen or noticed; attracting attention.
Example: Her bright red coat made her conspicuous in the crowd.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Hasty and therefore not thorough or detailed.
Example: He gave the document a cursory glance before signing it.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Intimidating or causing one to feel apprehensive.
Example: The prospect of moving to a new city was daunting but exciting.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To worship or regard as a god.
Example: The fans seemed to deify the actor, treating him like a deity.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Intended to teach, often in a way that is overly moralistic or patronizing.
Example: The teacher’s didactic tone made the lecture dull.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To spread or disperse widely.
Example: The organization works to disseminate information about health issues.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Possible to do easily or conveniently.
Example: Completing the project within the deadline seemed feasible.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To openly disregard a rule or convention.
Example: He chose to flout the traffic laws by speeding.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Consisting of parts or elements that are all the same kind.
Example: The town has a largely homogeneous population.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking excitement or variety; dull.
Example: Her routine had become humdrum, with little variation day to day.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking flavor, vigor, or interest.
Example: The soup was insipid and lacked any seasoning.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Tending to talk a great deal; talkative.
Example: The loquacious guest dominated the conversation at dinner.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Having a dislike of humankind.
Example: His misanthropic views made it hard for him to trust people.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A wrong or inaccurate name or designation.
Example: Calling the small pond a ‘lake’ was a misnomer.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Failing to take proper care in doing something.
Example: The company was found negligent in maintaining workplace safety.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Excessively eager to please or obey.
Example: The assistant's obsequious behavior annoyed his colleagues.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To make someone less angry or hostile.
Example: She tried to placate her friend after their argument.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A tendency to choose or do something regularly.
Example: He has a proclivity for solving complex puzzles.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Childishly silly and immature.
Example: His puerile sense of humor often annoyed his coworkers.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Extremely idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
Example: Her quixotic plans to save the world were admirable but unfeasible.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A person who spends money extravagantly.
Example: Despite earning a high salary, he was a notorious spendthrift.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech.
Example: The taciturn man rarely engaged in small talk.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers.
Example: She was wary of strangers offering unsolicited help.

Group2.info:
Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To make something poorer in quality by adding another substance.
Example: The company was accused of adulterating its products with cheap fillers.

Part of Speech: Verb / Noun
Definition:
(Verb): To publicly recommend or support.
(Noun): A person who publicly supports a cause or policy.
Example:
She advocates for equal pay in the workplace.
He is an advocate of environmental protection.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To increase the power, status, or wealth of someone or something.
Example: He used every opportunity to aggrandize his position within the company.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: Brisk and cheerful readiness.
Example: She accepted the invitation with alacrity.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
Example: He felt ambivalent about moving to a new city for the job.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To make something better or improve it.
Example: The government implemented reforms to ameliorate living conditions in rural areas.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Open and responsive to suggestions; easily persuaded or controlled.
Example: The staff was amenable to changes in the work schedule.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Belonging to a period other than the one being portrayed; outdated.
Example: The use of typewriters in the office seemed anachronistic.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Showing a willingness to take bold risks; daring or impudent.
Example: His audacious plan to start a business with no funding surprised everyone.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Having an extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
Example: The avaricious landlord raised the rent exorbitantly.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking in originality, so as to be obvious and boring.
Example: The film’s plot was banal and predictable.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Gentle and kind; not harmful.
Example: The tumor was found to be benign, much to everyone’s relief.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Bold and without shame.
Example: She made a brazen attempt to steal the show.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A false statement made to damage someone’s reputation; slander.
Example: The politician was the target of repeated calumnies during the campaign.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
Example: The photographer captured candid moments at the event.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To criticize or punish someone severely.
Example: The teacher castigated the student for cheating on the exam.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way; capable of burning or corroding.
Example: Her caustic remarks hurt his feelings.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To interpret or understand something in a particular way.
Example: His silence was construed as agreement.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Feeling or expressing remorse or penitence.
Example: She gave a contrite apology for her mistake.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Extremely complex and difficult to follow.
Example: The convoluted instructions left everyone confused.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To desire something belonging to someone else.
Example: He covets his neighbor's new car.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking in courage; cowardly.
Example: The craven decision to flee the battlefield was criticized.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: Behavior in keeping with good taste and propriety.
Example: She maintained her decorum even during the heated argument.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Demonstrating skill and cleverness.
Example: The artist’s deft brushstrokes created a stunning portrait.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To raise doubts or objections; to hesitate.
Example: She agreed to the plan without demur.

Part of Speech: Adjective / Noun
Definition:
(Adjective): Imitative of another person’s work; unoriginal.
(Noun): Something based on another source.
Example: The song was criticized for being derivative of older hits.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To remove the moisture from something; to dry thoroughly.
Example: The hot sun desiccated the crops in the field.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A forceful and bitter verbal attack.
Example: The article was a diatribe against political corruption.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Unwilling or unable to believe something; skeptical.
Example: He gave her an incredulous look when she told him the news.

Group3.info:
Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To reduce in amount, degree, or intensity.
Example: The storm finally began to abate after several hours.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To formally renounce or reject something.
Example: He abjured his former lifestyle and embraced a more disciplined one.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Deviating from what is standard, normal, or expected.
Example: The scientist discovered an anomalous result in the experiment.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: A deep-seated feeling of dislike or aversion.
Example: She felt an intense antipathy toward the new policies.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Understood by few; mysterious or secret.
Example: The professor’s lecture on quantum mechanics was full of arcane concepts.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
Example: The climb to the summit was arduous, but the view was worth it.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Without deceit or guile; innocent and simple.
Example: Her artless charm made her instantly likable.

Part of Speech: Adjective / Noun
Definition: (Adjective): Characterized by severe self-discipline and abstention from indulgence.
(Noun): A person who practices severe self-discipline and abstains from all forms of indulgence.
Example: He led an ascetic life, living in a small room and owning few possessions. The ascetic spent years meditating in isolation.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To make an unpleasant feeling less intense; to relieve.
Example: The medicine helped to assuage the pain.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To reveal or disclose something unintentionally; to be disloyal to someone.
Example: He betrayed his friend's trust by sharing their secrets.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Relating to the pleasant aspects of the countryside and country life.
Example: The bucolic landscape was a peaceful escape from city life.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To begin to grow or increase rapidly.
Example: The city's population began to burgeon as more people moved there for work.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Involving or producing a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
Example: The cacophonous noise of the city streets made it hard to concentrate.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To officially declare a person to be a saint or to treat someone or something as a great or important figure.
Example: The church canonized the bishop for his acts of charity.

Part of Speech: Verb / Noun
Definition: (Verb): To express severe disapproval of someone or something, typically in a formal statement.
(Noun): An expression of severe disapproval.
Example: The committee censured the executive for his unethical behavior. The senator faced censure for his controversial remarks.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: The use of trickery to achieve a political, financial, or legal purpose.
Example: The businessman resorted to chicanery to avoid paying his taxes.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To come together to form one mass or whole.
Example: The two companies coalesced to become a major force in the market.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Clear, logical, and convincing.
Example: Her cogent argument persuaded everyone at the meeting.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Evoking interest, attention, or admiration in a powerfully irresistible way.
Example: The movie had a compelling plot that kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To struggle to overcome a difficulty or to argue or assert something in a debate.
Example: The team contended with injuries but still managed to win the championship.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Abundant in supply or quantity.
Example: She took copious notes during the lecture.

Part of Speech: Adjective / Noun
Definition: (Adjective): Familiar with and at ease in many different countries and cultures.
(Noun): A person who is cosmopolitan, someone who is familiar with and comfortable in many different cultures.
Example: New York is a cosmopolitan city with people from all over the world. He is a true cosmopolitan, having lived in several countries.

Part of Speech: Noun
Definition: Respectful submission or yielding to the judgment, opinion, or will of another.
Example: He showed deference to his elders by listening attentively to their advice.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Lacking a clear plan or purpose; aimless.
Example: The conversation was desultory, jumping from topic to topic without any clear direction.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.
Example: She was diffident about speaking in public.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Slow to act or procrastinating.
Example: His dilatory behavior caused delays in the project.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To use ambiguous language to conceal the truth or avoid committing to a position.
Example: The politician equivocated when asked about his stance on the issue.

Part of Speech: Verb
Definition: To divide or cause to divide into two sharply contrasting groups or opinions.
Example: The debate over the new policy began to polarize the community.

Part of Speech: Adjective / Noun
Definition: (Adjective): Spending money or resources freely and recklessly.
(Noun): A person who spends money in an extravagant, wasteful way.
Example: The prodigal son returned after spending all his inheritance. His prodigal lifestyle eventually led him to bankruptcy.

Part of Speech: Adjective
Definition: Using more words than necessary; wordy.
Example: His verbose explanation only confused the audience further.
